benchmark_details.name: ArticulateRules
benchmark_details.overview: ArticulateRules is a dataset for evaluating how well language models can articulate rules which accurately describe their classification behavior when solving simple binary text classification tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate how competent large language models are at providing high-level explanations of their own internal processes.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmarks highlight limitations in LLMs' ability to articulate rules, particularly for GPT-3.

data.source: Generated according to predefined rule functions with adversarial inputs included.
data.size: 1500 examples (45 rule functions with multiple variations)
data.annotation: Automatically generated based on defined rules.

methodology.calculation: Model outputs are compared to the expected results using predefined rules.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates a model's ability to correctly articulate classification rules; low accuracy suggests a lack of understanding.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-3 scored below 10% articulation accuracy on most tasks, while GPT-4 achieved around 72% on select tasks.
methodology.validation: Dataset validation performed by comparing model outputs against expected outcomes.
